publicwhip.spmotion: *S3M-8068 Claire Baker: Congratulations to Heather MacMillan, Lifetime Diana Award Winner—That the Parliament congratulates Glenrothes High School’s Head Girl, Heather MacMillan, on receiving a lifetime Diana Award; considers that she takes a selfless and caring approach toward others both in school and in the wider community and commends her for it, and recognises the very positive work undertaken by young people like Heather MacMillan who are committed to helping others in every way possible.

S3M-8068 Claire Baker: Congratulations to Heather MacMillan, Lifetime Diana Award Winner—That the Parliament congratulates Glenrothes High School’s Head Girl, Heather MacMillan, on receiving a lifetime Diana Award; considers that she takes a selfless and caring approach toward others both in school and in the wider community and commends her for it, and recognises the very positive work undertaken by young people like Heather MacMillan who are committed to helping others in every way possible.
S3M-8068 Congratulations to Heather MacMillan, Lifetime Diana Award Winner (lodged on 3 March 2011) Jamie Hepburn*, James Kelly*, John Park*
S3M-8068 Congratulations to Heather MacMillan, Lifetime Diana Award Winner (lodged on 3 March 2011) Jackie Baillie*, Mary Mulligan*, Des McNulty*, Jack McConnell*
S3M-8068 Congratulations to Heather MacMillan, Lifetime Diana Award Winner (lodged on 3 March 2011) Hugh Henry*, Pauline McNeill*
S3M-8068 Congratulations to Heather MacMillan, Lifetime Diana Award Winner (lodged on 3 March 2011) Ken Macintosh*
S3M-8068 Congratulations to Heather MacMillan, Lifetime Diana Award Winner (lodged on 3 March 2011) Marilyn Livingstone*

S3M-8068 Claire Baker: Congratulations to Heather MacMillan, Lifetime Diana Award Winner—That the Parliament congratulates Glenrothes High School’s Head Girl, Heather MacMillan, on receiving a lifetime Diana Award; considers that she takes a selfless and caring approach toward others both in school and in the wider community and commends her for it, and recognises the very positive work undertaken by young people like Heather MacMillan who are committed to helping others in every way possible. Supported by: Jamie Hepburn, James Kelly, John Park, Jackie Baillie, Mary Mulligan, Des McNulty, Jack McConnell, Hugh Henry, Pauline McNeill, Ken Macintosh, Marilyn Livingstone
